activities: National Regulatory Services provides compliance technology and services to its clients.  For the National Regulatory Services clients using National Regulatory Services hosted solutions, personal information is uploaded to National Regulatory Services servers in the U.S. in order to perform the compliance services.  These services are required for compliance with many different regulatory agency requirements.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities will be referenced as National Regulatory Services independent recourse mechanism, available for investigation into unresolved complaints.  National Regulatory Services commits to cooperate and comply with the European Data Protection Authorities as described in FAQ 11 in order to follow the requirements set out by points A and C of the Enforcement Principle listed in the Safe Harbor Certification Guide.
